title: WOODLAND CRITTER CHRISTMAS
text: A panoramic view of South Park, day. Holiday music is heard in the background, and the scenes are played out as the narrator mentions them

title: WOODLAND CRITTER CHRISTMAS
text: Way up in the mountains in a small little town,

title: WOODLAND CRITTER CHRISTMAS
role: The Main Street was being decorated all up and down.

title: WOODLAND CRITTER CHRISTMAS
role: People stood in long lines, sometimes waiting hours or more,

title: WOODLAND CRITTER CHRISTMAS
role: Because Christmas need to be bought in a store.

title: WOODLAND CRITTER CHRISTMAS
role: But out in the forest, not too far away...

title: WOODLAND CRITTER CHRISTMAS
text: A nearby forest. The camera pans down from the sky and rest upon a Christmas tree. Forest animals gather round and decorate it.

title: WOODLAND CRITTER CHRISTMAS
text: ...The little woodland critters were also preparing for their Christmas day.

title: WOODLAND CRITTER CHRISTMAS
text: It's almost time when the time is here,

title: WOODLAND CRITTER CHRISTMAS
role: The time that's only once a year.

title: WOODLAND CRITTER CHRISTMAS
role: We can hardly wait, 'cause it's so near.

title: WOODLAND CRITTER CHRISTMAS
text: The little critters worked hard as they happily sang

title: WOODLAND CRITTER CHRISTMAS
role: And each one of them had a quite interesting name

title: WOODLAND CRITTER CHRISTMAS
role: There was Squirrely the squirrel, Rabbity the rabbit,

title: WOODLAND CRITTER CHRISTMAS
role: Beavery the beaver, and Beary the bear

title: WOODLAND CRITTER CHRISTMAS
role: Porcupiney the porcupine, Skunky the skunk,

title: WOODLAND CRITTER CHRISTMAS
role: Foxy the fox, and Deery the deer

title: WOODLAND CRITTER CHRISTMAS
role: Woodpeckery the woodpecker, Mousey the mouse,

title: WOODLAND CRITTER CHRISTMAS
role: and Chickadee-y the chickadee, all made the forest their house.

title: WOODLAND CRITTER CHRISTMAS
role: And on that magical day, stumbling upon all of that,

title: WOODLAND CRITTER CHRISTMAS
role: was a surprised little boy, in a red poofball hat.

title: WOODLAND CRITTER CHRISTMAS
text: What the hell?

title: WOODLAND CRITTER CHRISTMAS
text: Christmastime is once a year

title: WOODLAND CRITTER CHRISTMAS
role: Christmas means so much to us all

title: WOODLAND CRITTER CHRISTMAS
text: The forest. The critters approach Stan.

title: WOODLAND CRITTER CHRISTMAS
text: Well hello there. Welcome to our forest.

title: WOODLAND CRITTER CHRISTMAS
text: How do you like our Christmas tree?

title: WOODLAND CRITTER CHRISTMAS
text: It's... nice.

title: WOODLAND CRITTER CHRISTMAS
text: Why, it's the most perfect tree in the forest!

title: WOODLAND CRITTER CHRISTMAS
text: Oh no, I see a problem.

title: WOODLAND CRITTER CHRISTMAS
text: What is it, Mousey?

title: WOODLAND CRITTER CHRISTMAS
text: Our Christmas tree doesn't have a star.

title: WOODLAND CRITTER CHRISTMAS
text: Ohhhh

title: WOODLAND CRITTER CHRISTMAS
text: We can't have a tree with no star on it.

title: WOODLAND CRITTER CHRISTMAS
text: What are we gonna do?

title: WOODLAND CRITTER CHRISTMAS
text: Now don't be down, y'all. Maybe our new friend can help us find a star.

title: WOODLAND CRITTER CHRISTMAS
text: Can you really? Oh would you please? Could you help us?

title: WOODLAND CRITTER CHRISTMAS
text: Okay, okay.

title: WOODLAND CRITTER CHRISTMAS
text: Yay!!

title: WOODLAND CRITTER CHRISTMAS
text: And so, using some paper and working with glee,

title: WOODLAND CRITTER CHRISTMAS
role: the boy in the red poofball hat made a star for the tree

title: WOODLAND CRITTER CHRISTMAS
text: Ohhhh

title: WOODLAND CRITTER CHRISTMAS
text: It's the nicest star I ever saw.

title: WOODLAND CRITTER CHRISTMAS
text: The little critters cheered and Beavery said with a smile

title: WOODLAND CRITTER CHRISTMAS
text: How would you like to sing and dance with us for a while?

title: WOODLAND CRITTER CHRISTMAS
text: The boy in the red poofball hat smiled and said

title: WOODLAND CRITTER CHRISTMAS
text: Uh, no thanks, I'm gonna go home.

title: WOODLAND CRITTER CHRISTMAS
text: Goo, goodbye Stanny!

title: WOODLAND CRITTER CHRISTMAS
text: Goodbye, Stanny! Bye! Cya! I'll buy your hat!

title: WOODLAND CRITTER CHRISTMAS
text: Wugh.

title: WOODLAND CRITTER CHRISTMAS
text: Stan's bedroom, night. He's asleep in bed, but wakes up, turns over, and turns on his light

title: WOODLAND CRITTER CHRISTMAS
text: Hi, Stanny!

title: WOODLAND CRITTER CHRISTMAS
text: Oh, whatta?

title: WOODLAND CRITTER CHRISTMAS
text: His friends were all there! What a wonderful surprise!

title: WOODLAND CRITTER CHRISTMAS
role: The little boy smiled with joy in his eyes

title: WOODLAND CRITTER CHRISTMAS
text: What time is it!

title: WOODLAND CRITTER CHRISTMAS
text: You aren't gonna believe what happened, Stanny. It's the most magical Christmas gift ever!

title: WOODLAND CRITTER CHRISTMAS
text: Porcupiney is pregnant!

title: WOODLAND CRITTER CHRISTMAS
text: You guys, I have to go to school tomorrow.

title: WOODLAND CRITTER CHRISTMAS
text: I deduce the man-boy doesn't understand the seriousness of the fertilization.

title: WOODLAND CRITTER CHRISTMAS
text: Porcupiney is a virgin, Stanny. Her conception was immaculate.

title: WOODLAND CRITTER CHRISTMAS
text: She's gonna give birth to our Lord and Savior.

title: WOODLAND CRITTER CHRISTMAS
text: ...What?

title: WOODLAND CRITTER CHRISTMAS
text: It has been foretold unto me that I would give birth on Christmas Day.

title: WOODLAND CRITTER CHRISTMAS
text: So soon!

title: WOODLAND CRITTER CHRISTMAS
text: How delightful!

title: WOODLAND CRITTER CHRISTMAS
text: Our souls are saved!

title: WOODLAND CRITTER CHRISTMAS
text: Finally the critters are gonna have a Savior of their very own, of their very own!

title: WOODLAND CRITTER CHRISTMAS
text: There's just one problem: We don't have a manger for our Savior to be born in.

title: WOODLAND CRITTER CHRISTMAS
text: Awwww.

title: WOODLAND CRITTER CHRISTMAS
text: But we got to have a manger.

title: WOODLAND CRITTER CHRISTMAS
text: Can you do it, Stan. Can you build us a manger? Huh?

title: WOODLAND CRITTER CHRISTMAS
text: "Of course I'll build you a little manger!" the little boy cried,

title: WOODLAND CRITTER CHRISTMAS
role: and he winked at his critter friends and leapt to their side!

title: WOODLAND CRITTER CHRISTMAS
text: The forest. Stan has built the manger and is hammering the last few nails in place

title: WOODLAND CRITTER CHRISTMAS
text: And out in the woods the boy steamed right ahead,

title: WOODLAND CRITTER CHRISTMAS
role: making a place for the critter babe to lay its sweet head

title: WOODLAND CRITTER CHRISTMAS
text: Gee whiz, if it isn't the nicest manger I ever saw.

title: WOODLAND CRITTER CHRISTMAS
text: I deduce it shall serve as a perfectly suitable resting place, for the Son of our Lord.

title: WOODLAND CRITTER CHRISTMAS
text: Does this mean we can go to sleep now?

title: WOODLAND CRITTER CHRISTMAS
text: My Son will have the nicest bed in all the forest.

title: WOODLAND CRITTER CHRISTMAS
text: Fit for a king!

title: WOODLAND CRITTER CHRISTMAS
text: This is going to be the best critter Christmas ever!

title: WOODLAND CRITTER CHRISTMAS
text: It's almost time when the time is here,

title: WOODLAND CRITTER CHRISTMAS
role: The time that's only once a year.

title: WOODLAND CRITTER CHRISTMAS
role: We can hardly wait, 'cause it's so near-

title: WOODLAND CRITTER CHRISTMAS
text: All right, I'm going now

title: WOODLAND CRITTER CHRISTMAS
text: The mountain lion! Hide!

title: WOODLAND CRITTER CHRISTMAS
text: Go away! Shoo!

title: WOODLAND CRITTER CHRISTMAS
text: Is it gone?

title: WOODLAND CRITTER CHRISTMAS
text: I deduce it is.

title: WOODLAND CRITTER CHRISTMAS
text: I'm not c-c-comin' out.

title: WOODLAND CRITTER CHRISTMAS
text: Well, this is the end. The mountain lion obviously knows Porcupiney is pregnant, and he's gonna kill it again.

title: WOODLAND CRITTER CHRISTMAS
text: Again?

title: WOODLAND CRITTER CHRISTMAS
text: Every Christmas the mountain lion comes down and eats the virgin critter impregnated with the Son of our Lord.

title: WOODLAND CRITTER CHRISTMAS
text: Oh dear, I'm so very afraid.

title: WOODLAND CRITTER CHRISTMAS
text: Let's face it. The mountain lion will never let our Savior be born.

title: WOODLAND CRITTER CHRISTMAS
text: Awwww.

title: WOODLAND CRITTER CHRISTMAS
text: Hey, we shouldn't be upset this Christmas. We've got Stanny!

title: WOODLAND CRITTER CHRISTMAS
text: Of course! Stanny can do anything! If he can build a manger, he can stop that mean ol' mountain lion!

title: WOODLAND CRITTER CHRISTMAS
text: Christmas is saved!

title: WOODLAND CRITTER CHRISTMAS
text: The camera looks up from the woods to a mountain in the distance. Dramatic music plays

title: WOODLAND CRITTER CHRISTMAS
text: High up in the forest on a dark, craggy peak,

title: WOODLAND CRITTER CHRISTMAS
role: the horrid mountain lion and preyed on the weak.

title: WOODLAND CRITTER CHRISTMAS
role: For the critters to be saved, someone had to stop that nasty
text: old cat...

title: WOODLAND CRITTER CHRISTMAS
text: Goddamnit, this is fucking ridiculous!

title: WOODLAND CRITTER CHRISTMAS
text: Said the little boy in the red poofball hat.

title: WOODLAND CRITTER CHRISTMAS
text: he looks at a cave entrance, then up at the peak

title: WOODLAND CRITTER CHRISTMAS
role: Killing the mountain lion was no easy task,

title: WOODLAND CRITTER CHRISTMAS
role: but he thought of a plan, and he thought of it fast.

title: WOODLAND CRITTER CHRISTMAS
text: Grrr. Grrr! Come on out!  Come on, critter killer! Your days of slaughtering innocent little animals are over! Rawrrrrr! Rawrrrrr!

title: WOODLAND CRITTER CHRISTMAS
text: In a flash it was over! A victorious blow!

title: WOODLAND CRITTER CHRISTMAS
role: The mountain lion lay slain on the cold ground below.

title: WOODLAND CRITTER CHRISTMAS
text: The cave entrance. Stan sees that the mountain lion is motionless and approaches

title: WOODLAND CRITTER CHRISTMAS
text: Hokay, there.

title: WOODLAND CRITTER CHRISTMAS
text: Mommy? Mommy!  W... wake up, Mommy, wake up!

title: WOODLAND CRITTER CHRISTMAS
text: Don't leave us, Mommy.  Man-boy, why? Why did you kill our mommy? Why?

title: WOODLAND CRITTER CHRISTMAS
text: I... the... critters. Their... bir-birth of a Savior?

title: WOODLAND CRITTER CHRISTMAS
text: The tiny cubs all gathered together and cried,

title: WOODLAND CRITTER CHRISTMAS
role: All alone in the world because their mother had died.

title: WOODLAND CRITTER CHRISTMAS
text: Aw. Awww!

title: WOODLAND CRITTER CHRISTMAS
text: The forest floor, night. The critters have set up a campfire close to the manger and are keeping warm by it.

title: WOODLAND CRITTER CHRISTMAS
text: Oooo.

title: WOODLAND CRITTER CHRISTMAS
text: You all right, Lady Porcupiney?

title: WOODLAND CRITTER CHRISTMAS
text: Oh yes, just felt a little kick is all.

title: WOODLAND CRITTER CHRISTMAS
text: Well, it's been much too long now. Uh I'm afraid our helpful friend Stanny must be very dead.

title: WOODLAND CRITTER CHRISTMAS
text: Yep, the mountain lion probably swallowed him whole.

title: WOODLAND CRITTER CHRISTMAS
text: I guess that means our Savior is gonna be made into Savior stew.

title: WOODLAND CRITTER CHRISTMAS
text: Awwww.

title: WOODLAND CRITTER CHRISTMAS
text: Wait a minute, look!

title: WOODLAND CRITTER CHRISTMAS
text: Stanny!

title: WOODLAND CRITTER CHRISTMAS
text: Stanny, you're alive.

title: WOODLAND CRITTER CHRISTMAS
text: But, does that mean you killed the mountain lion?

title: WOODLAND CRITTER CHRISTMAS
text: It's dead.

title: WOODLAND CRITTER CHRISTMAS
text: For real and for true?

title: WOODLAND CRITTER CHRISTMAS
text: Are you sure.

title: WOODLAND CRITTER CHRISTMAS
text: I'm sure. It won't be hurting you anymore.

title: WOODLAND CRITTER CHRISTMAS
text: He did it! Now our critter Christmas can finally happen! Hail Satan!

title: WOODLAND CRITTER CHRISTMAS
text: Hail Satan!

title: WOODLAND CRITTER CHRISTMAS
text: Wait, wha-what?

title: WOODLAND CRITTER CHRISTMAS
text: You've done us a huge favor, Stanny! Without the mountain lion around, the Lady Porcupiney can give birth to the Antichrist!

title: WOODLAND CRITTER CHRISTMAS
text: Yaaay Satan!

title: WOODLAND CRITTER CHRISTMAS
text: Waiwait, the Antichrist?? You said she was giving birth to your savior!

title: WOODLAND CRITTER CHRISTMAS
text: Yeah, to the Son of our Lord, Satan, Prince of Darkness.

title: WOODLAND CRITTER CHRISTMAS
text: But I thought you meant the Son of God!

title: WOODLAND CRITTER CHRISTMAS
text: Well, think about it: You really think God would have sex with a porcupine?

title: WOODLAND CRITTER CHRISTMAS
text: No way! Only Satan, Prince of Darkness and King of all Evil would do that! Yay!

title: WOODLAND CRITTER CHRISTMAS
text: This just calls for a celebration! Let's sacrifice Rabbity and eat his flesh!

title: WOODLAND CRITTER CHRISTMAS
text: Yay! Sacrifice me to the Devil!

title: WOODLAND CRITTER CHRISTMAS
text: the other critters cheer. Stan is frozen stunned as Beary pulls up a satanic altar on a small wagon with a little help from Squirrely. The other animals bring Rabbity up to the altar. Rabbity is propped up on the altar and Beary tears him apart with a big knife. The other animals crowd in, tear away pieces of the body, and eat them raw

title: WOODLAND CRITTER CHRISTMAS
text: Drink his blood! Drink his blood!

title: WOODLAND CRITTER CHRISTMAS
text: Blood orgy!!!

title: WOODLAND CRITTER CHRISTMAS
text: Yay, blood orgy! Blood orgy, yay!

title: WOODLAND CRITTER CHRISTMAS
text: the critters drench themselves in Rabbity's blood and begin the orgy. Beavery mounts Raccoony, Skunky mounts Porcupiney, Mousey mounts foxy, and Beary mounts Deery. Squirrely hope onto Deery's left ear and mounts that. Chickadee-y flits around. In the background is heard "Sting, so true!" Stan is traumatized now.

title: WOODLAND CRITTER CHRISTMAS
text: What special time and special day,

title: WOODLAND CRITTER CHRISTMAS
text: Hail Satan.

title: WOODLAND CRITTER CHRISTMAS
text: The forest floor, night. The critters return to the manger and decorate it. As the narrator speaks, the following takes place. The star atop the manger is turned so it points down. Owls bring flowers to the mountain lion's corpse. The lion cubs are shown, then the mountain peak, then Stan is shown with his head buried into his arms at his desk in his room

title: WOODLAND CRITTER CHRISTMAS
text: In the gentle forest clearing on Christmas Eve morn,

title: WOODLAND CRITTER CHRISTMAS
role: The little forest critters prepared for the Antichrist to be
text: born.

title: WOODLAND CRITTER CHRISTMAS
role: The noble mountain lion had stopped evil in all the years past,

title: WOODLAND CRITTER CHRISTMAS
role: But now the good protector lay dead as the good owls amassed.

title: WOODLAND CRITTER CHRISTMAS
role: And meanwhile three lion cubs were crying away.

title: WOODLAND CRITTER CHRISTMAS
role: For them there would certainly be no Christmas Day,

title: WOODLAND CRITTER CHRISTMAS
role: And soon the forest would suffer from the offspring Satan begat.

title: WOODLAND CRITTER CHRISTMAS
role: All of this because of the little boy in the red poofball hat.

title: WOODLAND CRITTER CHRISTMAS
text: Ugh.

title: WOODLAND CRITTER CHRISTMAS
text: Now that he'd killed the noble lion queen,

title: WOODLAND CRITTER CHRISTMAS
role: there was nobody to stop the Apocalypse, it seemed.

title: WOODLAND CRITTER CHRISTMAS
text: Uuugh!

title: WOODLAND CRITTER CHRISTMAS
text: "I know!" he said with a new happy grin,

title: WOODLAND CRITTER CHRISTMAS
role: "I'll go back to the forest and speak with those critters again!"

title: WOODLAND CRITTER CHRISTMAS
text: No nonono.

title: WOODLAND CRITTER CHRISTMAS
text: He ran out the living room, turned out the light,

title: WOODLAND CRITTER CHRISTMAS
role: and went back to the forest to set everything right!

title: WOODLAND CRITTER CHRISTMAS
text: Stan enters the living room, hops on the sofa, and turns on the TV. "The Jeffersons" theme song is heard.

title: WOODLAND CRITTER CHRISTMAS
text: ... and went back to the forest to set everything right!

title: WOODLAND CRITTER CHRISTMAS
text: Stan looks at the show, willfully ignoring the narrator

title: WOODLAND CRITTER CHRISTMAS
role: ... He tried to forget all about it by watching TV

title: WOODLAND CRITTER CHRISTMAS
text: Stan tries to change channels, but the remote is broken

title: WOODLAND CRITTER CHRISTMAS
role: but his conscience caught up with him and to the forest he did
text: flee.

title: WOODLAND CRITTER CHRISTMAS
role: ... He thought he could hide from his problems - not true!

title: WOODLAND CRITTER CHRISTMAS
text: Stan rolls his eyes

title: WOODLAND CRITTER CHRISTMAS
role: He knew in his heart the thing he had to do!

title: WOODLAND CRITTER CHRISTMAS
text: Leave me aLONE!!

title: WOODLAND CRITTER CHRISTMAS
text: He knew that only by going to the forest could he-

title: WOODLAND CRITTER CHRISTMAS
text: All right all right all right!! God!!

title: WOODLAND CRITTER CHRISTMAS
text: The manger at the forest clearing, day. The animals continue decorating

title: WOODLAND CRITTER CHRISTMAS
text: Hey, look everyone! It's our old pal, Stanny.

title: WOODLAND CRITTER CHRISTMAS
text: Oh boy, Stanny. You came just in time!

title: WOODLAND CRITTER CHRISTMAS
text: Yeah. We've got a big problem.

title: WOODLAND CRITTER CHRISTMAS
text: The Great Satan has commanded that when the Antichrist is born, we must find a human host body to transfer it into.

title: WOODLAND CRITTER CHRISTMAS
text: That way he could take over the whole world. The whole world!

title: WOODLAND CRITTER CHRISTMAS
text: The human must be non-baptized and heathenistic against Christ.

title: WOODLAND CRITTER CHRISTMAS
text: We figured you'd be perfect!

title: WOODLAND CRITTER CHRISTMAS
text: Yay!

title: WOODLAND CRITTER CHRISTMAS
text: I'm not a heathen! I was baptized and my family's Christian!

title: WOODLAND CRITTER CHRISTMAS
text: Awwwww.

title: WOODLAND CRITTER CHRISTMAS
text: But we got to have a human host body for the Antichrist.

title: WOODLAND CRITTER CHRISTMAS
text: Oh dear, maybe we won't have a critters C-Christmas after all.

title: WOODLAND CRITTER CHRISTMAS
text: Now don't be down, y'all. Stanny can help us find non-baptized heathen human.

title: WOODLAND CRITTER CHRISTMAS
text: Will you really, Stanny?

title: WOODLAND CRITTER CHRISTMAS
text: No!! I'm not doing you anymore favors and I'm not letting you give birth to the Antichrist!  I came here to put a stop to all this!

title: WOODLAND CRITTER CHRISTMAS
text: To stop us?

title: WOODLAND CRITTER CHRISTMAS
text: But gee whiz, Stan, if you try to stop us, we'd have to use our evil satanic powers on ya.

title: WOODLAND CRITTER CHRISTMAS
text: Right, whatever.  I'm taking down the manger I built.  Ah!  Aaaah!!  Aagh! Aaaahh!  AAAAAAAH!! AAAAAAAH!!

title: WOODLAND CRITTER CHRISTMAS
text: Oh boy! Our satanic powers sure did the trick!

title: WOODLAND CRITTER CHRISTMAS
text: Our powers get stronger every day, get stronger every day!

title: WOODLAND CRITTER CHRISTMAS
text: Sorry Stanny, but you see, nothing can stop the birth of the Antichrist, except for a mountain lion.

title: WOODLAND CRITTER CHRISTMAS
text: And you got rid o'her.

title: WOODLAND CRITTER CHRISTMAS
text: Yay!

title: WOODLAND CRITTER CHRISTMAS
text: The boy shook with anger! He broke a sweat and fell ill

title: WOODLAND CRITTER CHRISTMAS
role: When he remembered there were three mountain cubs still alive
text: on the hill!

title: WOODLAND CRITTER CHRISTMAS
text: Oh yeah.

title: WOODLAND CRITTER CHRISTMAS
text: The mountain peak, day. Stan climbs up to the cave again.

title: WOODLAND CRITTER CHRISTMAS
text: Hello? Anybody in there?

title: WOODLAND CRITTER CHRISTMAS
text: Oh no, it's the man-boy who killed Mommy!

title: WOODLAND CRITTER CHRISTMAS
text: He's come to kill us now.

title: WOODLAND CRITTER CHRISTMAS
text: It's okay. I died inside when Mommy was killed anyways.

title: WOODLAND CRITTER CHRISTMAS
text: Yeah, better this than the slow death we'd face without a mother around.

title: WOODLAND CRITTER CHRISTMAS
text: Look, I'm sorry I killed your mom. The, the squirrel told me she was evil.

title: WOODLAND CRITTER CHRISTMAS
text: You got tricked by a squirrel? Gee, you're not too smart, are you, mister?

title: WOODLAND CRITTER CHRISTMAS
text: I'm trying to make this all right again, but the only thing that can stop devil-worshiping critters is a mountain lion!

title: WOODLAND CRITTER CHRISTMAS
text: Yeah, and you killed her.

title: WOODLAND CRITTER CHRISTMAS
text: Well, you're mountain lions.

title: WOODLAND CRITTER CHRISTMAS
text: Us? No, we're just kids. We still have our baby teeth.

title: WOODLAND CRITTER CHRISTMAS
text: And our baby claws.

title: WOODLAND CRITTER CHRISTMAS
text: And a dead mom.

title: WOODLAND CRITTER CHRISTMAS
text: There still has to be a way for you to kill the porcupine's baby.

title: WOODLAND CRITTER CHRISTMAS
text: What? You mean like in an abortion?

title: WOODLAND CRITTER CHRISTMAS
text: Yeah. An abortion. That can work.

title: WOODLAND CRITTER CHRISTMAS
text: But, we don't know how to give abortions.

title: WOODLAND CRITTER CHRISTMAS
text: Do you know some place we can learn, mister?

title: WOODLAND CRITTER CHRISTMAS
text: "Where can they learn that?" the boy said with a frown.

title: WOODLAND CRITTER CHRISTMAS
role: "I know! The abortion clinic just outside of town."

title: WOODLAND CRITTER CHRISTMAS
text: What?!

title: WOODLAND CRITTER CHRISTMAS
text: So he picked up the cubs and down the mountain he stormed.

title: WOODLAND CRITTER CHRISTMAS
role: And took them to where abortions are performed.

title: WOODLAND CRITTER CHRISTMAS
text: No, he didn't.

title: WOODLAND CRITTER CHRISTMAS
text: Yes he did.

title: WOODLAND CRITTER CHRISTMAS
text: No, he didn't!

title: WOODLAND CRITTER CHRISTMAS
text: Yes he did.

title: WOODLAND CRITTER CHRISTMAS
text: No, he didn't!!

title: WOODLAND CRITTER CHRISTMAS
text: Yes he  did!

title: WOODLAND CRITTER CHRISTMAS
text: Aw Goddamnit!

title: WOODLAND CRITTER CHRISTMAS
text: Said the boy in the red poofball hat! "We've made it already, little cubs! Fancy that!"

title: WOODLAND CRITTER CHRISTMAS
text: Excuse me, what are you doing here?!

title: WOODLAND CRITTER CHRISTMAS
text: The abortion doctor inquired.

title: WOODLAND CRITTER CHRISTMAS
text: If you wanna be in the OR, a pass is required!

title: WOODLAND CRITTER CHRISTMAS
text: I don't know, I, I'm supposed to show these mountain lions how an abortion is performed or something, I... I know, it'd ridiculous.

title: WOODLAND CRITTER CHRISTMAS
text: Well, you're in luck, I'm happy to inform!

title: WOODLAND CRITTER CHRISTMAS
role: It's only three days until Christmas, so I have LOTS of abortions
text: to perform!

title: WOODLAND CRITTER CHRISTMAS
role: Gather around my table, cute little lions,

title: WOODLAND CRITTER CHRISTMAS
role: I'll teach you to do abortions without even tryin'!

title: WOODLAND CRITTER CHRISTMAS
text: And so the little boy and the cubs gathered around the chair base,

title: WOODLAND CRITTER CHRISTMAS
role: And all day watched abortion after abortion take place.

title: WOODLAND CRITTER CHRISTMAS
text: Montage. The doctor puts on his gloves and the cubs peer into the patient's vagina. Stan peers in as well, from a distance. The doctor works away happily and cleans up well. The patient leaves, and the next one is worked on. One of the cubs is on a desk next to a bottled fetus. He hops off, knocking the bottle off as well. The bottle pops open and the fetus falls out. Everyone turns and sees the fetus on the floor, and laugh about it. The doctor works on the next patient and the dark cub brings him some forceps. The doctor smiles and strokes the cub's head. The other two cubs snuggle up to the patient on her shoulders, and she smiles at them

title: WOODLAND CRITTER CHRISTMAS
text: Christmas time is once a year.

title: WOODLAND CRITTER CHRISTMAS
role: Christmas means so much to us all.
